{"id":360289846,"question_id":342,"lang":"python3","lang_name":"Python3","time":"4 years, 8 months","timestamp":1593532468,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"32 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/360289846/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Power of Four","memory":"13.7 MB","code":"class Solution:\n    def isPowerOfFour(self, n: int) -> bool:\n        if n == 1:\n            return True\n        if n > 0 and n&(n-1) == 0 and n&(0x55555555) == n:\n            return True\n        return False\n'''\nThe(num - 1) % 3 == 0is used to distinguish the 4^n from 2^n.\n2^n = (3-1)^n = C(n,0)3^n(-1)^0+....+(-1)^n.\n1.When 2^n is 4^n, which means n is even, in this case, (-1)^n==1 and (2^n-1）%3==0\n2.When 2&n is not 4^n, which means n is odd, in this case, (-1)^n=-1 and (2^n-1）%3==1；\nThis is why we can use(num-1)%3==0 as a condition to sperate 4^n from 2^n.\n'''","compare_result":"","title_slug":"power-of-four","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
